hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Pairs Reversion on 3-Day Z-Score Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 3-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±2.0 standard deviations from its 30-day mean, the pair will revert to its mean within 5 trading days with >60% probability in NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain strong long-term correlation (0.75+). In NEUTRAL regimes, temporary divergences caused by idiosyncratic news or flows tend to revert as market participants arbitrage the relationship. The 3-day z-score captures short-term dislocations while 30-day mean provides stable equilibrium.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH price ratio 3-day z-score > +2.0 (enter short BTC/long ETH)
BTC/ETH price ratio 3-day z-score < -2.0 (enter long BTC/short ETH)
30-day rolling correlation between BTC and ETH > 0.75
Both assets' 10-day ATR < 5% of price (low volatility environment)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean reversion probability < 60% OR average holding period > 5 days for profitable trades OR correlation breaks down during NEUTRAL regimes.
